diaries.title: Day 1 - First Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Your smile lights up my world in ways words can’t explain. Even now, it still finds its way into my heart and makes everything feel warm again.

diaries.title: Day 2 - Second Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Every moment with you was a treasure I’ll always carry inside me. No matter how far we’ve gone, those memories still whisper softly, reminding me of what love once felt like.

diaries.title: Day 3 - Third Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I keep thinking about how your laughter could brighten even my worst days. It’s funny how something so simple could mean so much.

diaries.title: Day 4 - Fourth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Sometimes I miss the calm between us, those quiet moments where words weren’t needed. Just being beside you was enough.

diaries.title: Day 5 - Fifth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I hope life’s being kind to you. You deserve peace, laughter, and every bit of happiness this world can give.

diaries.title: Day 6 - Sixth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
It’s strange how time moves on, yet some feelings stay. I’m learning that missing you doesn’t mean I’m stuck, it just means I cared deeply.

diaries.title: Day 7 - Seventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
You taught me to love with my whole heart, even if it hurts sometimes. And for that, I’ll always be thankful.

diaries.title: Day 8 - Eighth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I saw something today that reminded me of you, a little thing, but it made me smile instead of ache. Maybe that’s progress.

diaries.title: Day 9 - Ninth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
If I could go back, I’d still choose to meet you. Even if we ended up apart, it was still one of the best chapters of my life.

diaries.title: Day 10 - Tenth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Some nights, I replay our memories like a movie. Not because I’m stuck in the past, but because those moments were real, and I don’t want to forget them.

diaries.title: Day 11 - Eleventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
You were my calm in chaos, my soft place to land. Thank you for being that person, even if just for a while.

diaries.title: Day 12 - Twelfth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve stopped asking why things had to change. Maybe some stories are meant to end early, just to teach us something unforgettable.

diaries.title: Day 13 - Thirteenth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Sometimes, letting go isn’t about forgetting. It’s about learning to smile without needing what’s gone.

diaries.title: Day 14 - Fourteenth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I hope you’re smiling somewhere right now. That thought alone is enough to make my day brighter.

diaries.title: Day 15 - Fifteenth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve realized love doesn’t disappear, it just changes form. Mine has turned into quiet gratitude for everything we shared.

diaries.title: Day 16 - Sixteenth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
When I think of you now, it doesn’t hurt as much. It feels like looking at a sunset, beautiful, even though it’s fading away.

diaries.title: Day 17 - Seventeenth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve stopped waiting for your texts or calls. Instead, I’m learning to write to you here, quietly, peacefully, in my own way.

diaries.title: Day 18 - Eighteenth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I don’t know if you’ll ever read this, but I hope you know you were loved, truly, deeply, and sincerely.

diaries.title: Day 19 - Nineteenth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
There’s a calm in my heart now. I guess that’s what healing feels like, remembering without breaking.

diaries.title: Day 20 - Twentieth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
This may be the twentieth letter, but my wish stays the same: may you always find the happiness you once brought into my life.

diaries.title: Day 21 - Twenty-First Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I still think about the way you used to look at me, like you saw the good parts I couldn’t see myself. I hope you see that in you, too.

diaries.title: Day 22 - Twenty-Second Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I heard a song today that took me back to us. Instead of sadness, it brought a gentle smile. Maybe that’s what moving on really feels like.

diaries.title: Day 23 - Twenty-Third Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
If I could say one more thing, it would be this, thank you for showing me what it means to love without fear.

diaries.title: Day 24 - Twenty-Fourth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Sometimes I still catch myself wondering how you’re doing. I hope your days are filled with light, laughter, and calm mornings.

diaries.title: Day 25 - Twenty-Fifth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’m slowly learning to be okay with the silence. It’s not empty anymore, it’s peaceful.

diaries.title: Day 26 - Twenty-Sixth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I think I’ve forgiven everything, you, me, the ending. There’s no anger left, only understanding.

diaries.title: Day 27 - Twenty-Seventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Your memory used to feel heavy. Now it’s like a soft breeze, still there, but gentle.

diaries.title: Day 28 - Twenty-Eighth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I realized that healing isn’t about erasing you, it’s about learning to carry love differently.

diaries.title: Day 29 - Twenty-Ninth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
If you ever think of me, I hope it’s with kindness. That’s how I think of you now.

diaries.title: Day 30 - Thirtieth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Halfway through these letters, and I feel lighter. You’ll always be part of my story, just not my ending.

diaries.title: Day 31 - Thirty-First Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
There are days I still miss you deeply, but it doesn’t ache the same way. I guess time really does heal in quiet ways.

diaries.title: Day 32 - Thirty-Second Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I hope someone out there makes you laugh the way you used to laugh with me. You deserve that kind of joy forever.

diaries.title: Day 33 - Thirty-Third Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Love changes, but it never truly ends. It just becomes softer, quieter  like a song fading out beautifully.

diaries.title: Day 34 - Thirty-Fourth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Sometimes I look back and realize  even the pain had purpose. It taught me strength and patience.

diaries.title: Day 35 - Thirty-Fifth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I no longer feel lost when I think of you. I just feel thankful that we crossed paths.

diaries.title: Day 36 - Thirty-Sixth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve started to dream new dreams, ones that are mine alone. But you’ll always be part of what taught me to hope.

diaries.title: Day 37 - Thirty-Seventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
If we ever meet again someday, I hope we smile, not with sadness, but with peace.

diaries.title: Day 38 - Thirty-Eighth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve realized love doesn’t mean holding on forever. Sometimes it means letting go beautifully.

diaries.title: Day 39 - Thirty-Ninth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve stopped writing these to fix the past. Now, I write them to remember how far I’ve come.

diaries.title: Day 40 - Fortieth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
You’ll always be a piece of my heart’s history, not the whole story, but a meaningful chapter.

diaries.title: Day 41 - Forty-First Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I found an old photo of us today. I didn’t feel sad, just nostalgic, and that’s a kind of healing too.

diaries.title: Day 42 - Forty-Second Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Sometimes I think maybe we met to learn how to love better, for the next time, for the next person, or maybe just for ourselves.

diaries.title: Day 43 - Forty-Third Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’m learning to love myself the way I once loved you, gently, patiently, and completely.

diaries.title: Day 44 - Forty-Fourth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
The nights don’t feel as empty anymore. Maybe that’s because I’ve started filling them with new dreams instead of old memories.

diaries.title: Day 45 - Forty-Fifth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I hope one day you find someone who sees you exactly the way I did, with wonder and warmth. You deserve that always.

diaries.title: Day 46 - Forty-Sixth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve grown a lot since we parted. The world feels bigger now, and I’m not afraid to explore it anymore.

diaries.title: Day 47 - Forty-Seventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
This journey taught me something precious, love is never wasted, even when it ends.

diaries.title: Day 48 - Forty-Eighth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
If I could talk to my past self, I’d tell them not to be sad, because every heartbreak leads to a better version of yourself.

diaries.title: Day 49 - Forty-Ninth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I think I’m ready to stop writing now. Not because I’ve forgotten you, but because I’ve finally made peace with everything.

diaries.title: Day 50 - Fiftieth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Fifty days, fifty letters, and one simple truth: I will always wish you the best, wherever life takes you. Thank you for being part of my story.

diaries.title: Day 51 - Fifty-First Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Today I realized healing isn’t forgetting, it’s remembering without pain. I’m proud of how far I’ve come.

diaries.title: Day 52 - Fifty-Second Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I woke up feeling light today. Maybe this is what peace feels like, soft, steady, and earned.

diaries.title: Day 53 - Fifty-Third Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve started finding beauty in small things again, morning light, quiet songs, even empty roads. It feels good to notice life.

diaries.title: Day 54 - Fifty-Fourth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
It’s strange, I no longer write these to reach you, but to reach me. Every word feels like stitching my own heart back together.

diaries.title: Day 55 - Fifty-Fifth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I smiled at myself in the mirror today. For the first time in a long while, it didn’t feel forced.

diaries.title: Day 56 - Fifty-Sixth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve been spending more time outside lately, it’s peaceful to just breathe and exist without needing a reason.

diaries.title: Day 57 - Fifty-Seventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I think I’ve learned that love doesn’t vanish, it transforms into gratitude, then into quiet strength.

diaries.title: Day 58 - Fifty-Eighth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve stopped replaying what went wrong. Now, I focus on what went right, how much I grew from loving you.

diaries.title: Day 59 - Fifty-Ninth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I feel calmer these days. Maybe healing isn’t dramatic maybe it’s just waking up without the heaviness.

diaries.title: Day 60 - Sixtieth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
It feels good to look forward again. My heart’s no longer stuck in the past, it’s learning to dream.

diaries.title: Day 61 - Sixty-First Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’m learning to be kind to myself, the same way I once was with you. It feels new, but right.

diaries.title: Day 62 - Sixty-Second Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve realized closure doesn’t come from words, it comes from acceptance, and I finally have that.

diaries.title: Day 63 - Sixty-Third Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Sometimes, I catch myself humming again. I didn’t notice when the silence left, but I’m glad it did.

diaries.title: Day 64 - Sixty-Fourth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
The world feels brighter lately. Maybe it was never dim, maybe I just needed time to see the light again.

diaries.title: Day 65 - Sixty-Fifth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I met new people today, and it didn’t feel wrong. My heart has room for new laughter now.

diaries.title: Day 66 - Sixty-Sixth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
It’s strange how peace sneaks in quietly, no big moment, just a steady calm that stays.

diaries.title: Day 67 - Sixty-Seventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’m not the same person I was when we said goodbye, I’m softer, wiser, and more at peace with myself.

diaries.title: Day 68 - Sixty-Eighth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
It’s Christmas today. I used to think I couldn’t celebrate without you, but I did, and it felt okay.

diaries.title: Day 69 - Sixty-Ninth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I don’t chase what left anymore. I trust that what’s meant for me will stay, or return in a new way.

diaries.title: Day 70 - Seventieth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve learned to thank the past without living in it. That’s real freedom, I think.

diaries.title: Day 71 - Seventy-First Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
It’s the end of the year soon. I’m proud of the version of me that kept going, even when it hurt.

diaries.title: Day 72 - Seventy-Second Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
As the new year comes, I’m letting go of what no longer serves me, gently, lovingly, without regret.

diaries.title: Day 73 - Seventy-Third Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Goodbye, 2025. You were full of lessons, tears, and healing. I’m ready for what’s next.

diaries.title: Day 74 - Seventy-Fourth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Hello, 2026. I start this year with peace in my heart and hope in my hands.

diaries.title: Day 75 - Seventy-Fifth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I no longer need answers. Some things just end, and that’s okay, it makes room for new beginnings.

diaries.title: Day 76 - Seventy-Sixth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
My heart feels quiet, but full. I’m learning to love the calm after the storm.

diaries.title: Day 77 - Seventy-Seventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’m grateful, not just for us, but for everything that came after. Growth, healing, strength.

diaries.title: Day 78 - Seventy-Eighth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve stopped comparing my present to the past. This version of life feels just right.

diaries.title: Day 79 - Seventy-Ninth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Love still lives here, not for you, but for the world, for myself, for what’s ahead.

diaries.title: Day 80 - Eightieth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve started journaling for me, not us. It feels freeing, like breathing after holding my breath too long.

diaries.title: Day 81 - Eighty-First Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve realized self-love isn’t selfish, it’s the foundation for every other kind of love.

diaries.title: Day 82 - Eighty-Second Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Somewhere along the way, I stopped missing what was and started loving what is.

diaries.title: Day 83 - Eighty-Third Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’m proud of myself, for staying soft in a world that tried to harden me.

diaries.title: Day 84 - Eighty-Fourth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Today, I looked up at the sky and smiled. I think that’s what peace looks like, endless and light.

diaries.title: Day 85 - Eighty-Fifth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I no longer write to fill a void, I write because I love how words can heal.

diaries.title: Day 86 - Eighty-Sixth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve learned that love, true love, teaches us to grow even after it’s gone.

diaries.title: Day 87 - Eighty-Seventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I used to fear endings. Now, I see them as quiet beginnings in disguise.

diaries.title: Day 88 - Eighty-Eighth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’ve stopped wishing for what could’ve been. Instead, I’m building what can be.

diaries.title: Day 89 - Eighty-Ninth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’m at peace. That’s all I ever really wanted, not to move on, but to move forward.

diaries.title: Day 90 - Ninetieth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I look back with no bitterness. Just a quiet thank you for the chapter that shaped me.

diaries.title: Day 91 - Ninety-First Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
There’s beauty in endings. They teach us to appreciate beginnings.

diaries.title: Day 92 - Ninety-Second Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’m surrounded by love, from friends, from the world, from myself. And that’s enough.

diaries.title: Day 93 - Ninety-Third Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
If I could tell you one thing now, it’s this: I’m happy. Truly.

diaries.title: Day 94 - Ninety-Fourth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
The ache is gone. What remains is light, and I carry it gently wherever I go.

diaries.title: Day 95 - Ninety-Fifth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
You’ll always be part of the reason I learned to love deeply. And for that, I’m endlessly grateful.

diaries.title: Day 96 - Ninety-Sixth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
My heart feels whole again. It carries love, not loss.

diaries.title: Day 97 - Ninety-Seventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I’m learning that the best love stories are the ones we build with ourselves.

diaries.title: Day 98 - Ninety-Eighth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I hope you’ve found your peace, too. Because I finally found mine.

diaries.title: Day 99 - Ninety-Ninth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
This journey began with heartbreak, but it ends with strength. I made it through.

diaries.title: Day 100 - One Hundredth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
One hundred letters later, and I’ve learned love doesn’t always last, but it always teaches. Thank you, Tina, for being my lesson and my light.

diaries.title: Day 101 - One Hundred and First Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Sometimes I think the universe smiled the day you were born. You carry a light in you that never fades, not even when life tries to dim it. You’re lucky, not because everything is easy, but because you were given a heart that can still love after breaking, a soul that still believes after falling. You are the kind of lucky that comes from being genuine, from being exactly who you are, even when the world changes around you.

diaries.title: Day 102  One Hundred and Second Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
You may not see it, but you are the most lucky person I’ve ever met, not for what you have, but for what you give. You give peace just by existing, kindness without expecting anything back, and love in its purest form. The world becomes softer when you’re in it. If luck had a face, it would look like yours, bright eyes, a heart full of care, and a smile that makes time pause for a moment.

diaries.title: Day 103 - One Hundred and Third Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
You are lucky because you live with sincerity, something rare and beautiful. You don’t chase attention, yet the world naturally turns toward you. You don’t try to impress, yet your presence impresses. I’ve watched how even the simplest things, your laugh, your way of talking, your quiet thoughts, make everything feel softer. It’s as if life itself bends gently when you walk through it. That’s a kind of luck only a few ever carry.

diaries.title: Day 104 - One Hundred and Fourth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
You might not realize this, but you were born with a heart that turns ordinary days into something magical. That’s your luck, Tina. The way you make others feel seen, the way you listen without judgment, and the way you hold moments as if they matter, that’s something even time can’t take away. People like you leave traces of light wherever they go, and I feel lucky just to have walked near that glow.

diaries.title: Day 105 - One Hundred and Fifth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
The more I think of it, the more I realize how lucky you truly are, not because life gave you everything, but because you learned how to turn every little thing into something beautiful. You turn pain into poetry, mistakes into lessons, and memories into warmth. You are lucky because you understand love, not as something to own, but something to share. And that makes your heart shine brighter than anything else in this world.

diaries.title: Day 106 - One Hundred and Sixth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
You are lucky in the way the moon is lucky, silent, steady, and always glowing no matter how dark the sky gets. You don’t ask for much, yet somehow you give more than most people ever could. You’re lucky because you have peace within you, the kind that can’t be bought or faked. You remind me that true luck isn’t about fortune or fame; it’s about being loved for simply being who you are. And you, Tina, are exactly that, pure, rare, and unforgettable.

diaries.title: Day 107 - One Hundred and Seventh Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
I sometimes think you’re the kind of lucky that angels talk about quietly, not the kind that wins prizes, but the kind that wins hearts without trying. You’re lucky because you carry love like sunlight, it touches everything and everyone, and yet there’s always more to give. I’ve never met anyone whose soul felt as honest as yours. The world is lucky to have you, Tina, and so am I, for ever knowing you existed this way.

diaries.title: Day 108 - One Hundred and Eighth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
Luck isn’t always about what happens to us, it’s about how we see the world. And that’s what makes you so lucky. You find joy in rain, strength in silence, hope in endings. You turn everything life gives, even pain, into something meaningful. People cross paths with you and leave a little better, a little lighter. That’s not coincidence; that’s your quiet magic, your endless grace. That’s the luck that never runs out.

diaries.title: Day 109 - One Hundred and Ninth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
You’re lucky because you’re real. In a world full of pretending, you stay true to your feelings, even the messy ones. You love deeply, you care honestly, and you walk through life with your heart open, even after being hurt. That’s courage, Tina, and courage is the rarest kind of luck. You’ve made every person who’s known you a little braver, including me. You’ll never know how much light you’ve left behind just by being yourself.

diaries.title: Day 110 - One Hundred and Tenth Letter
diaries.content:
Dear Tina,
If there’s such a thing as fate, I think yours is written in golden ink. You are lucky, Tina, not because of what you have, but because of what you are. You are warmth wrapped in laughter, honesty dressed as kindness, and strength hidden behind gentle eyes. Every story you touch changes for the better. And if someone ever asks me what luck looks like, I’ll tell them: it looks like you, real, radiant, and rare beyond words.

diaries.title: Special Letter - The Day We First Met
diaries.content:
Hey Tina,
Tina still remember the day we first met at the robotics competition? That time, Tina was just someone Warun suddenly noticed in the crowd. Warun didn’t even plan to care about anyone new, but when Warun saw Tina, something just paused inside. Warun kept thinking, “Siapa dia tu?” and before Warun realised it, Warun just wanted to know Tina more.

Lepas tu, Warun minta kawan tolong dapatkan nombor Tina, and that was how both of us started talking. Those early days felt so simple but full of meaning in every chat and every small laugh. One day, Warun confessed to Tina and Tina accepted. Warun still remember that moment so clearly. It felt like something new had finally started.

Then came all the memories, the calls, the jokes, the small fights, the things only both of us would understand. Even though things changed later, Warun will never forget how real those moments felt.

Before we broke up, Warun decided to ajak Tina keluar. Even though it was just for a while, that day meant a lot to Warun. We had fun together. Warun still remember buying that capybara plushie for Tina, belanja Mixue, ambil gambar sama-sama, makan sebelah. It wasn’t anything fancy but it felt special because it was with Tina. Warun still remember how Tina smiled that day, how Tina made everything around feel calm and warm. Those memories will always stay, not because they were perfect but because they were real.

Tina, Warun harap Tina akan selalu ingat that Warun still care, even if things between us are not the same anymore. Tina was the first person who treated Warun right, who showed that Warun could still smile even when life felt heavy. No matter where life brings us after this, Warun will always be thankful that our paths crossed. Tina will always have a small and quiet space inside Warun’s heart, not out of sadness but out of gratitude for everything we shared.
